chapter.title: Conversion to EPUB
chapter.p: As of 2019-05-14 there is a conversion process that creates an EPUB version, though it is still experimental. This is useful as on offline version, which is superior to a PDF in some ways, such as font face and font size being controlled by the software in an e-reader device. However, it is inferior to the online version (), since many interactive features cannot function within the EPUB version.

We use offline MathJax tools to convert mathematics into SVG images. Otherwise the EPUB version is similar to the HTML version. Look in the examples directory for a conversion script that will explain more of the details. We plan to continue to improve this conversion.
